title: Understanding Select Statement
text: The SELECT statement is used to retrieve data from a database, with the option to specify which columns to return. In this case, Taylor is selecting the 'Street' and 'ZIP' columns from the 'Customers' table.

title: ORDER BY Clause
text: The ORDER BY clause is used to sort the result set of a query by one or more columns. The number after ORDER BY, like $$2$$ in "ORDER BY 2", refers to the position of the column in the SELECT list.

title: Identify the columns being selected
text: In both queries, what column names are used in the SELECT statement?

hintAnswer: Ascending order based on ZIP values
title: Effect of ORDER BY Clause
text: What would be the order of the rows in the query results for Query 2?
choices: Random order without any specific sorting
Ascending order based on ZIP values
Descending order based on Street names
